MS MCQs

    Get started with Microsoft Power Platform Center of Excellence

    »

    1. What is the difference between the CoE Starter Kit Power BI report and the out-of-the-box reports in the Power Platform admin center?

      They cover only canvas apps, Power Automate flows, and Dataverse

      It is the same as what is covered in the Power Platform admin center

      They cover more resources such as model-driven apps and chatbots, which are not in the Power Platform admin center

      You have the option to build your own customized Power BI report


    2. Which Power Platform services are used in the Power Platform CoE?

      Apps in Power Apps and Power Automate flow only

      Power Apps canvas and model-driven apps, Power Automate flows, Dataverse tables, and Power BI report

      Power Automate flows, Dataverse tables, and Power BI report

      Apps in Power Apps and Power BI report


    3. How do you install the CoE Starter Kit?

      The CoE Starter Kit is a set of zipped files that are solutions that you import into your Power Platform environment in a systematic order. You then turn on the flows to collect the data in your Dataverse tables and then connect your Power BI report to the environment.

      The CoE Starter kit is a single zipped file that has a single EXE file that does all the installation and configuration automatically.

      The CoE Starter Kit is a set of zipped files that are solutions that you import into your Power Platform environment in any order that you want. You then run the flows to collect the data in your Dataverse tables and then connect your Power BI report to the environment.

      The COE Starter Kit comes as a single solution as a zipped file that you import into your Power Platform. You then activate all the flows and apps, which will also configure the Power BI report.


    4. How much coding is involved in setting up and configuring the CoE Starter Kit?

      25 percent of coding by using Visual Studio is required to configure the solutions to match your tenant

      50 percent of coding by using Visual Studio is required to configure the Power Apps and Power Automate solutions to match your tenant

      Low-code PowerShell scripting is required to import all solutions in your tenant

      No coding is required
